item.title: Birth of Thanaticism
item.description:
Birth of Thanaticism

> But depression is a subsidiary aspect of thanaticism. You are supposed to be depressed, and you are supposed to think that’s your individual failing or problem. Your bright illusory fantasy-world is ripped away from you, and the thanatic reality is bared – you are supposed to think its your fault. You have failed to believe. See a shrink. Take some drugs. Do some retail therapy.

item.title: Sex, Circuits & Deep House " bunnie's blog
item.description:
Sex, Circuits & Deep House " bunnie's blog

This year for Burning Man, I built a networked light badge for my theme camp, "The Institute". Walking in the desert at night with no light is a dangerous proposition - you can get run over by cars, bikes, or twist an ankle tripping over an errant bit of rebar sticking out of the ground.

item.title: From Gongkai to Open Source " bunnie's blog
item.description:
From Gongkai to Open Source " bunnie's blog

About a year and a half ago, I wrote about a $12 "Gongkai" cell phone (pictured above) that I stumbled across in the markets of Shenzhen, China. My most striking impression was that Chinese entrepreneurs had relatively unfettered access to cutting-edge technology, enabling start-ups to innovate while bootstrapping.

item.title: No title
How TV Ruined Your Life S1E2P1
item.description:
How TV Ruined Your Life S1E2P1

Charlie Brooker explores the gulf between real life and television. From kids shows to Countdown, TV has something to infuriate anyone of any age. NOTE: Just to clear the mass confusion about the sitcom starring Kevin Eldon, it is fake. It is a sketch demonstrating Charlie's opinion about the stupidity of sitcoms aimed at teenagers today.

item.title: There is something extraordinary happening in the world
item.description:
There is something extraordinary happening in the world

We still haven't realized of something extraordinary that is happening. A few months ago, I freed myself from society, I've released myself from attachments I had and fear that locked me to the system. And since then, I started seeing the world from a different perspective.

item.title: This Is Not PrivateTech art from Let It...
item.description:
This Is Not PrivateTech art from Let It...

This Is Not PrivateTech art from Let It Brain is a video portrait display which applies facial details of the viewer to the subject using facial recognition technology:This work explores the possibilities of empathy as a meta-language through the most powerful physical interface which is our face.
